results.title: The Sheep = La Pecora
results.brief_description: 15 wholesome minutes of playful ovine gambolling, as a father patiently answers his earnest young son’s many searching queries on the subject of sheep.

results.title: The Shearers
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shearing teams are at work in different parts of Australia for most seasons of the year. This film tells the story of the shearers arriving at a typical sheep station and of their accommodation, the preparation of the various machines, combs and cutters - all of those things which must be attended to before the men begin work next morning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Alexander and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Shattered silence
results.creator_credit: Morton Parker, John Howe and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film about noisy adolescents, motorcycles, and the tendency of some adults to make blanket judgments without troubling to know the facts. The film is designed to prompt discussion of what youngsters and their elders have a right to expect of each other. It touches on some basic principles of democracy and raises questions about the problem of communication between the generations. Cast includes: Bernard Behrens, Anthony Brown, Vernon Chapman, Lawrence Cherniak, Mignon Elkins, Eric Endersby, Cec Linder.

results.title: The Sharks
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Noxon and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Not all sharks are dangerous to humans. Observing sharks around the world, the film addresses humankind’s fear and hatred of sharks and offers facts - about the shark’s anatomy, behaviour, and vulnerability to people.

results.title: The Sharkcallers of Kontu
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies and O'Rourke and Associates Filmakers
results.brief_description: In a few villages on the west coast of Papua New Guinea a handful of men still practise the ancient ritual of sharkcalling. Colonisation and economic exploitation is slowly bringing to a close this spectacular and dangerous ritual. Dennis O’Rourke lived with the people to learn about sharkcalling and to understand the forces affecting their culture. Edited by Stewart Young. Photographed by Dennis O’Rourke and Chris Owen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies and O’Rourke and Associates Filmakers

results.title: The Shape of things
results.creator_credit: Jacques Giraldeau, Marcel Martin and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An international symposium on sculpture held in Montreal in the mountain park overlooking the city. Follows the work of eleven sculptor from nine countries as they chip, chisel and hammer. Shows their finished sculptures left in the park for the pleasure of passers-by.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Giraldeau, Marcel Martin and ONF | NFB

results.title: The Shape of the Earth
results.brief_description: Deals not only with the shape of the earth but also with such closely related physical properties as its size, rotation rate and its shift relative to its axis of rotation.

results.title: The Shape of plastics
results.creator_credit: Alan Pendry, Michael Clarke and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Shows the role of research chemist in the formulation of new polymers; takes a quick look at plastic production in the processing plants, and dazzles the viewer with colourful examples of the varied consumer goods. Bronze Medal, Barcelona, 1963; Gold medal, Bilboa, 1963.

results.title: The Shah of Iran's visit to Australia 1974
results.brief_description: Official greeting by the Governor General Sir William Kerr, the Prime Minister and Mrs Whitlam, as well as senior parliamentarians and leading members of the diplomatic corps, mark the beginning of a busy week of engagemnets for the Royal couple through the Eatern states of Australia.
